title: Microsoft | SDE2 L61 | Bangalore
content:
**Compensation details** - 

Education: B.Tech Non-CS Tier 1
Years of Experience: 3 years 3 months
Current role: Senior software engineer at Big US MnC
Date of the Offer: Nov 2024
Company: Microsoft
Title/Level: SDE II, L61
Location: Bangalore
Salary: 25L
Relocation Bonus: 2.8L
Signing Bonus: None
Stock compensation: $55K stock grant vested over 4 years (~11.5L per year)
Bonus: 0-20%, ~2.5L (assuming 10% for 1st year)
Stock bonus every year: performance based, assuming $12K vested over 5 years (~2L for first year)
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 25L + 2.5L + 2L + 11.5L = ~41L for first year
Benefits: Standard microsoft benefits

Other details: Do not have any other offers. Tried to negotiate, asked to increase stock grant from $55K to $100K, request rejected. However they are still open to hear reasonable increase in stock grant. 

**Current compensation** - 
Base : 17.8L
Bonus: 1.7L
Stock compensation: Fixed no. of units, next year 195 stocks will vest, value: 195 X 186(current stock price) X 84 (usd-inr) = 30L
Total comp : 17.8L + 1.7L + 30L = ~50L

Current compensation is heavily dominated by stock and depends on the current stock price 


What do you guys think about the offer?

title: Visa Inc SE-1 Compensation | Bangalore
content:
**Education**: BE from a tier-3 college
**Years of Experience: 2 years 3 months
**Current** **CTC**: INR 12.2 LPA
**Date of the Offer:** 8th November 2024
**Company**: Visa Inc
**Title/Level**: Software Engineer - I
**Location**: Bangalore
**Salary**: Basic INR 14,00,000 per annum
**Relocation/Signing Bonus**: None
**Stock bonus:** None
**Bonus**: 10% of basic, can be extended upto 25%
**Total comp (Salary + PF + Gratuity + Bonus)**:  INR 16,57,600 per annum
**Benefits**: Education allowance, standard Visa benefits
**Competing offers**: None yet


This feels like I'm being lowballed a lot. This is my first time ever seeing an offer that did not include a joining bonus. I also thought Visa offers stock options. There is nothing in the other components that even attempts to make up for the lack of this. I'm feeling pretty dejected about this. What do you guys think? Has this been the standard lately?
